explanation:
Agent A is correct. MISRA C:2023 Rule 17.8 forbids modifying a function parameter itself (the pointer value), even though the object pointed to may be modified. In lfs_rename_ the code calls lfs_dir_find(lfs, &oldcwd, &oldpath, ...) and lfs_dir_find(lfs, &newcwd, &newpath, ...). lfs_dir_find has prototype taking const char **path and assigns '*path = name;' in its body, so when called with &newpath (or &oldpath) it changes the value of the local parameter variable newpath (and oldpath) inside lfs_rename_. That is a modification of a function parameter and therefore violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.

Suggested fixes: do not pass the address of the parameter. Instead make a local copy (e.g. const char *local_newpath = newpath;) and pass &local_newpath to lfs_dir_find, or change the API/qualification consistently if appropriate.
